Package com.webfirmframework.wffweb.css

Class FontSize

java.lang.Object
com.webfirmframework.wffweb.css.core.AbstractCssProperty<FontSize>
com.webfirmframework.wffweb.css.FontSize
All Implemented Interfaces:
CssProperty, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
public class FontSize
extends AbstractCssProperty<FontSize>
 font-size: medium | xx-small | x-small | small | large | x-large | xx-large | smaller | larger | length | initial | inherit;

 Initial:        medium
 Applies to:     all elements
 Inherited:      yes
 Percentages:    refer to inherited font size
 Media:          visual
 Computed value:         absolute length
Since:
1.0.0
See Also:
Serialized Form

    • getValue

      public java.lang.Float getValue()
      gets the fontSize in float value. FontSize#getUnit() should be used to get the cssLengthUnit for this value.
      Returns:
      the value in float or null if the cssValue is initial or inherit.
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • getUnit

      public CssLengthUnit getUnit()
      Returns:
      the cssLengthUnit PX/PER, or null if the value is any inbuilt value like inherit.
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • setCssValue

      public FontSize setCssValue​(java.lang.String cssValue)
      Specified by:
      setCssValue in class AbstractCssProperty<FontSize>
      Parameters:
      cssValue - the value should be in the format of 55px or 95%. null is considered as an invalid value and it will throw NullValueException.
      Returns:
      the current object.
      Since:
      1.0.0
